author: Anonymous Atom
title: PSET 11 Q1
question:
I'm having a bit of trouble interpreting what the type of the output should be for this question. The question asks for the total amount of gold AND the list of accessible treasures. I don't think (?) we've ever dealt with a function that has an output of two things ( i.e. (@signature X Y -> W Z)). Is it supposed to be something like (listof W (listof Z)) (although I'm pretty sure this is "illegal") or something else? Any help would be appreciated!
edit: Also, side note, do we need to include the input treasure as one of the "accessible treasures" in the ouput? Thanks.
student_answer: A function can only have one output. Try reading the question description again while keeping this in mind; that's where your misunderstanding is.
